reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely 5 day break in Bologna at the end of April and we stayed in the Regina Hotel having got a good deal online.It is well situated just 10 minutes walk from the Piazza Maggiore and about 15 mins from the train station.
reviews.title: Goog Three Star Option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and the staff were most helpful with excellent English.On our arrival at 8.30 pm we asked about some place to dine and were directed to the Donatello restaurant just around the corner where we had a very good meal in a very pleasant atmosphere .A great start to our holiday!
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was fine with a good big bed but the bathroom was tiny. We are not very big but we had difficulty getting into the shower !If one was large it would have been impossible!Bedlinen was changed every second day.One quibble - the towels were not towels at all but just like the glass cloths used for polishing glasses! They were surprisingly absorbent but rather odd.
reviews.title: Not Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent and the red-haired waitress (sorry I don't know her name) was just delightful. She brought good coffee latte from the bar and kept the supply of sparklong water.fruit, hams, cheeses,croissants and cake topped up. A very good start to the day.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The BGA bus from the airport - 5 euro each way is very convenient for this hotel as it stops just a few metres from the hotel .It comes every 20 minutes and the journey takes 20-25 minutes depending on traffic.
reviews.title: Smart place to stay

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nigths and I do not have any complaint. Staff very helpfull and friendly. Room very clean, no noise from the street (my room was on 1st floor), great breakfast. Near railway station and Piazza Maggiore. I recommend this hotel for for sure.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in the middle of August. Clean and tidy rooms. Although I would concur with a previous reviewer's comments regarding small shower cubicles. At this hotel the shower tray seemed to be 3 feet x 2.5 feet, as opposed to the normal 3 feet square normally used. I know it's just a difference of 6 inches, however this can mean having a comfortable shower or a cramped shower.......I had the latter..!!
reviews.title: Well situated hotel

likes.disliked: — rooms a little small & small shower cubicles

reviews.text: The shower was my only gripe regarding the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Clean & Tidy & value for`money
Perfect Location
reviews.text: The location was good too. Between the Piazza Maggiore and Train station. Parking is really good & safe in the underground car park next door. The cost for one night's parking is 14.5€. Well worth it just to be sure that your hire car is safe.

reviews.title: Bed Bugs
reviews.text: I was surprised On reading the last review of this hotel ,My wife & I have just come back from staying in room 125 & it was spotless.

reviews.title: TINY showers!
reviews.text: This hotel is definitely in a great location in Bologna. Walking distance to everything you want to see, and 5 minutes to the train station. I was there for a trade show, and the #28 bus that took you right to the Bologna Fiere had a stop 1 block from the hotel.

However, only half of the staff was very courteous, especially if you didn't attempt to speak Italian. The showers were smaller than a phone booth -- don't drop the soap or you won't be able to pick it up! All rooms have the same bathroom set-up -- no bath tubs. Not the cleanest place, and the A/C didn't work so it was hard to sleep at night for the heat. No clock in the room. No internet access unless you have a computer and can use dial-up to a local number.
reviews.title: Excellent mid-priced hotel
Equal of some 4 stars
reviews.text: I've stayed in all sorts of European hotels, agritourismos and B&B's, and for the money I paid ($225/night!) it was not worth it to me. But if you are looking for location, this or the Hotel Tre Vecchi right next door is good. If you can spend the money, go for the Hotel Baglio, the Sofitel or the Excelsior which all have excellent locations but cost more.
